fields.summary: fields in Outlook don't match
Issue when creating a new Jira calendar - project loading indefinitely
People calendar event uses Events Calendar icon as user avatar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50540].
  {panel}

Spun off from TEAMCAL-502.:

Open Team Calendars on node 1 and then on node 2 with the same user => Error 
This error persists until I clean the cache ("Calendar Plugin - Popular sub-calendar subscription statistics").

I'm not sure when this was introduced (might have always existed). Seems to be caused by the wrong type of object in the popular subscriptions cache.

If you have multiple UALd servers and one of them doesn't have the latest jira-ical feed, then TEAMCAL-417 feature doesn't work

  {panel}

Hi,

One of our customer wants to embed the "Upcoming Events" on a Confluence page and wants to hide it from dashboard.
Can we have a feature to 'hide a calendar' ?

Regards,
Ruchi

ics import issue

fields.description:
Dear Support team,

I am trying to subscribe to the following Drupal calendar feed within Confluence: 
http://zpi.patrulrinpoche.net/calendar/ical/2011/all

However, I guet the following error:
"The data read from http://zpi.patrulrinpoche.net/calendar/ical/2011/all does not seem like iCalendar. Your calendar was not added."

The above subscription works perfectly in Google Calendar. 

Thanks for your support,

Matthieu
fields.summary: Drupal iCal feed - subscription problem
Scroll bar does not look right on the list of fields in the subscribe to Jira calendar dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50526].
  {panel}

#Scenario 1
- Delete application link
- JIRA is still running

Result: 500 Error not encountered in Team Calendars in Confluence. 

#Scenario 2
- Delete application link
- Emptying the cache

Result: 500 Error IS encountered in Team Calendars in Confluence. 

#Scenario 3
- Re-create application link
- JIRA is shut down

Result: 500 Error not encountered in Team Calendars in Confluence

#Scenario 4
- Delete application link
- JIRA is shut down

Result: 500 Error IS encountered in Team Calendars in Confluence

#Scenario 5
- Startup JIRA
- Application link not created

Result: 500 Error IS encountered in Team Calendars in Confluence

#Scenario 6
- Startup JIRA
- Application link is re-created

Result: NO 500 Error in Team Calendars in Confluence

#Scenario 7
- JIRA is running
- Application link exist
- Delete a project in JIRA that is associated with a calendar in Confluence

Result: NO 500 Error in Team Calendars in Confluence

#Scenario 8
- JIRA is running
- Application link exist
- jira-ical-feed plugin is disabled

Result: Team Calendars complains of a connection problem - "You may want to check the connection to XXX".

Conclusion: 500 errors will occur if the application link is deleted.

Assignee and Status incorrect in JIRA event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50514].
  {panel}

The team calendars works fine within the personnel space, but when embedded within another page we get the following error:

Error rendering macro 'calendar' : com.atlassian.renderer.v2.macro.MacroException: The calendar id can only contain letters or numbers

I have tried turning both the following on:
* Relaxed parsing mode
* Relaxed validation mode

but neither have made any difference.

We are currently running an evaluation copy (installed today 07-11-11), and would like a fix (with enough time to conduct a full evaluation) before the license runs out.

Please find attached a copy of the support request file.
fields.summary: Calendar returns macro error when displaying calendars within a page.

fields.description:
If you have a page with an embedded team calendar and attempt to make a comment the page fails to render correctly and shows several javascript errors.

Disabling either Team calendars or Refinedwiki resolves the issue.

As far as I am aware this only effects IE 7. Firefox does not have the same issue

The work around is to disable the calendar macro by escaping it before attempting to comment

by adding escaping backslashes to the macro  \\\{ ... \\\} the macro is disabled and you can post a comment after posting the comment you must remove the backslashes

Upgrading to IE8 is not an option at this time as this is a corporate environment and IE8 is not due to be deployed for several months.
fields.summary: Team calendar on a page with refinedwiki does not render properly when making comments in IE7
License page should not redirect to UPM (if UPM 2.0 is installed)

fields.description:
This is on EAC. Sherif has witnessed the problem. It seems to only happen to my account but can reproduce on different machines when using my credentials.

The "team calendar" section in the dashboard doesn't appear and inspecting the page shows the following:

- the team calendar javascript file is included in the page and the calendar web item shows up correctly in the profile menu
- reloading or refreshing the dashboard page does nothing
- thinking it may be related to the hyphen in my name, Bill changed his name to include a hyphen and that didn't help.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50502].
  {panel}

The default 200 events per calendar can be rather limiting, for some of our enterprise customers. 

The workaround posted [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/%27Some+events+were+not+shown+in+the+calendars+below+because+there+were+too+many+of+them%27+error+in+Team+Calendar] to add the {{-Dcom.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.display.events.calendar.maxpercalendar=500}} startup parameter to get around this limitation works, but the calendar performance is hit dramatically especially when we have more than 400 events per calendar.

Is there any way we can improve the performance of the Team Calendars in such situations?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Performance issue with too many events per calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50501].
  {panel}

Hi team!

I am receiving a error when I try to import a file generated in Outlook 2007.

I attached two .ics files where CorrectExportedFile.ics is used to export a calendar from Confluence to Outlook. This works properly. But a error is raised when I try to export (WrongContentFileToImport.ics) from Outlook to Confluence calendar.

Any idea what is happening?

I have other question: exists any documentation about how to integrate Team Calendars and Outlook? Is it possible? I mean if is possible the sincronization between Team calendar and Outlook.

Thanks in advance.
Kind regards,

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50496].
  {panel}

Related issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-22283

[Display URL|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Editing+an+Application+Link] is configured when configuring Application Link in the Confluence admin panel. This URL is used when displaying JIRA links in Confluence in the browser.

But Team Calendars links to JIRA issues using the Application URL and not the Display URL.

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project on JIRA, with an issue that has a due date
# Set up an Application Link between Confluence and JIRA by navigating to {{Confluence Admin >> Application Links}}, make sure the Display URL is different than the Application URL.
# Add a JIRA calendar to Team Calendars using this guide: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Adding+a+JIRA+Calendar
# Make sure that you are able to see the issue you created in Step 1 in your Team Calendars.
# Hover over the issue, right click and copy link address. Notice that the link is based on the Application URL and not the Display URL in step 2.
fields.summary: Links to JIRA Issues are created based on Application-URL and not on Display-URL

Hi,
I have installed team calendar plugin (version 1.9.1) on confluence 3.5 version, i have exported the existing calender and imported on confluence 3.5 version. To include the calendar on the page i have followed the instructions as mentioned here (While editing a page, click 'Insert' > 'Macro' > 'Team Calendars'). But still i am not able to view the calendar on my confluence page. Its showing *unknown macro:Calendar*. Please refer attached screenshot for details. Let me know how can i fox this issue. 

Thanks'

Hi, 

We (RefinedWiki) have a customer which have noticed a problem when changing page size by hiding the left column of the RefinedWiki Original Theme.

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/85918/team-calendars-and-refined-wiki-creates-some-distortion?page=1#87644

It looks like all event items in the calendar have a fixed width which is recalculated when you change the width of the browser window. But when you are hiding the left column the recalculation doesn't take place. 

Do you guys have any input on how to solve this issue? I guess you have bind an event which detects when the browser window is changed and then fire the recalculation event. 

Thanks for the help

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50453].
  {panel}

There is probably nothing that can be done about this on the Team Calendars side, but I am logging this as an FYI for any customers using Team Calendars on Confluence Standalone on OD a la carte.

If the user adds a profile pic using <username> -> profile then this profile picture will not propagate to Team Calendars (or Confluence even).

If the user wants this profile picture to appear on Team Calendars then they will have to change their profile picture via Browse -> User Settings -> Profile TAB -> Picture

Related JIRA Studio / OnDemand issues:
* https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-5120
* https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-5693
fields.summary: Studio Profile pics do not appear on Team Calendars in Studio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50452].
  {panel}

The message shown to users when their Team Calendars plugin has expired could benefit from some re-wording to better communicate the On Demand model.

The current messages are:
* *Admins:* Calendar in read-only mode. Please update Team Calendars Plugin's license [here|http://my.atlassian.com].
* *Non-admins:* Calendar in read-only mode. Please ask your administrator to update the Team Calendars Plugin license.

Specifically, we'd like to avoid  the word "license", since the license is effectively an implementation detail in On Demand (the customer never sees it).
Instead we'd like to go with the following:
* *Admins:* This calendar is read-only. To work with calendars, please [renew your Team Calendars subscription|http://my.atlassian.com].
* *Non-admins:* This calendar is read-only. Please ask your administrator to renew your Team Calendars subscription.
fields.summary: Message when license has expired in On Demand does not reflect the On Demand subscription model.

Hi, 

I've installed Team Calendars 1.1.0 via UPM in Confluence 3.5.5. When I paste the license (evaluation) in the configuration form and click update button, it redirects to a "page not found exception" showing the following message:

Steps to reproduce: 
1. Create a new JIRA calendar
2. Pick a server 
3. Start typing some JQL
4. Oops, you've realised you got the wrong server, now change the server
5. You you realize that the the "Display" field is wrong, it resets to project, but it's still showing JQL.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50442].
  {panel}

Since Conflunece's default #header positon is relative,

(can check from /download/superbatch/css/batch.css )

'Team Calendars' plugin has #header { position: static; } css in it.

It changes offsetParent of <div class="aui-dd-parent quick-nav-drop-down" style=""> (which determines Confluence Quick Search Result Box) from div#header to div#full-height-container

which makes it skip <div id="header-precursor">'s height and occurs design problem.

(Other plugin makes DIV inside div#header-precursor and Confluence Search Result Box ignores its height and appear up than usual)



I was about to put

jQuery('#header').attr("style","position:relative !important;"); to revert #header's position into relative,

but I'm aware of design problem might occur with Team Calendars Plugin.

Is it safe to roll back to relative?
fields.summary: Team Calender changes #header position to 'static'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50422].
  {panel}

Hello,

I've installed Confluence 4.2.8 with Team Calendars 2.3.2, and entered the evaluation period on both. I've purchased both now, and Confluence's license is upgraded to a regular one.

However, when I go to Browse => Confluence Admin => Manage Plugins, then find the Team Calendars plugin, click Configure, then try to go to the "License Configuration" tab, it automatically returns to Confluence's list of installed plugins (the Manage Plugins section).

Giving me no chance to enter any new license key.

Kind regards,

Daniël Mostertman

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50407].
  {panel}

Jay reported this.

Sherif's notes:

I can actually re-produce this every time on EAC.
1. Create a page, put a calendar in it, embed a events calendar (e.g. atlassian company events)
2. Save the page
3. Takes about 35 seconds on EAC

Now try it again without the calendar macro, or try any other macro (E.g. status) - takes around 15 seconds...

It happens all the time, something we are doing with our calendar macro that could be causing this?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50405].
  {panel}

Today you rolled out the new sidebar in Confluence Cloud for me. I now have a second sidebar on the left to switch between spaces, and my page tree looks different.

I'm sure you had reasons to do this. But it has two major drawbacks:
 # It makes working with Confluence considerably slower, because the page tree takes several seconds to load each time (even with a very decent Internet connection).
 # The additional sidebar consumes space on my small screen for something I don't need.

Please provide an option to switch back to the old sidebar / page tree which was much faster, more compact and more configurable!
fields.summary: Make the new sidebar / page tree optional

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50402].
  {panel}

Our team leverages the team calendar confluence plug in. All in all it works really well, but it would be much more useful if we could do that following:

- We use the calendars to track release calendars across our products and platforms, and external partners. One frustration we have is that within each calendar we typically only use the "event" option, but we can't customize this at all. This is super annoying. For example we want to have 1 partner calendar to track all those release dates and milestones and be able to color code them. Unfortunately we can only do that by creating a new calendar (this is really annoying for the team working on all the partner projects as they have to keep adding and removing calendars frequently).
- Create an easily printable view for a user specified amount of time (1 week to multiple months)
- Create the ability to export the team calendar info - PDF and spreadsheet would be great (Would be super helpful for when we work with external partners for project management)
- Create the ability to view more than 1 month at a time. Ideally if I scrolled down on a month view it would pull in the next weeks and I wouldn't have to skip to the next month. Or I could specify the date ranges to Display
fields.summary: Allow for multiple customized "event" types & dates on Calendars

  {panel}

Use case:
* A user is at the month of March then he scrolls down to the end of the month. 
* He should see April calendar listed
* Click on the second of April then it would be nice if the calendar switches automatically to the month April

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50396].
  {panel}

Dear Calendars Team,

Since you added new feature - Events. I have a few questions that I need to resolve before upgrade production version of our Team Calendars:

1) Our company employees use jointly some calendars (as on attached screenshot). Bring new feature as "Events" do confusion for our employees because each calendar explicitly define what kind of even to create and there is no need for additional events for each calendar. And it is obviously that it is no need to have even "leaves" for Meetings calendar or Business Trips calendar.

So my questions is how to hide events at all?

2) What is acceptable with Team Calendars new release is icons. That is why I would like to find out how to stick icon - "airplane" with Business Trip calendar, icon "leaves" with Annual and Compensatory Leaves Calendar and so on.

3) As well I would like to know how to add our own icons to another calendars such as Absence to due Illness, Meetings, Out of the Office Reports?

Using Android version 4.0.4 on different Android devices I am not able to add subscription url link to S-Planner or Calender (default application  with operating system by Google). If url https://host.domain:port/paht , I have only 50 characters for path on Android device.

host.domain - 33 characters in my personal case

This is actually a blocker to use Team Calender on Android devices.
I think it is not necessary to make quite long URL for subscription.
